definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: You are a layman in the field of oceanology.
sentences.chinese: 你在海洋學方面是個門外漢。
有一次海洋學家跟蹤一些波浪。

sentences.english: Preparatory Assistance for the Establishment of an Oceangraphic Instate Phase I .
sentences.chinese: 建立海洋學院第一階段的籌備性援助。

sentences.english: How she was this great oceanographer.
sentences.chinese: 她是個如何偉大的海洋學家。

sentences.english: Merchant Marine Academy in 1969, my educated dad was happy.
sentences.chinese: 1969年，我從美國商業海洋學院畢業了。

sentences.english: The ship then sends the data via high-speed fiber-optic lines to a series of command centers, where oceanographers can analyze results in real time.
sentences.chinese: 在控制中心，海洋學家們可以實時分析數據結果。

sentences.english: Nor is this China’s only oceanographic enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 然而這並非中國唯一的海洋學勘測計劃。

sentences.english: Oceanographers use the same principles to explore the ocean floor and the land under it.
sentences.chinese: 海洋學家利用同樣的原理去勘探海底及其下面的地面。

sentences.english: Despite the constraints, Recinos was determined to study oceanography.
sentences.chinese: 儘管困難重重，雷西諾斯還是決心要學習海洋學。

sentences.english: Academy in 1969, my educated dad was happy.
sentences.chinese: 1969年，我從美國商業海洋學院畢業了。
